fields.summary: Username conflicts related to case
Trying to create the user "'><script>altert('testuser')</script> while in gapps mode triggers IllegalStateException

fields.description:
h2. Final Update: (!)

We have implemented a workaround in our backend systems for this problem. This will allow existing and new Atlassian OnDemand users to log in via Google Apps.

Some new Google Apps users will be created without a first or last name, however. The fix for that problem is tracked in AOD-7281.

h2. Symptoms

Some users are receiving the following message when trying to login to OnDemand when Google-Apps is enabled:

!gapps.png|width=450!
fields.summary: Unexpected error in the authentication system when trying to login when Google-Apps is enabled

fields.description:
When a user accesses "Forgot username or password", chooses Password, provides email Username and clicks Email, the message received has the "Reset my password" button, but the HTML appears not to be rendered correctly, so it does not appear. See Snap1.jpg.

Mousing over the area will make the cursor change indicating an HTML link is present. See Snap2.jpg.
fields.summary: "Reset my password" button does not appear on Lotus Notes

fields.description:
Browsers can somehow interfere with JIRA new user email to set password. The new user won't receive any email from JIRA in order to set the password.

h3. Workaround
Try create the new user in Chrome incognito mode or Firefox private mode.
fields.summary: Browsers can somehow interfere with JIRA new user email to set password

fields.description:
- screenshot1 - groups with descriptions
- screenshot2 - column *Description* is empty
fields.summary: Cannot see groups description on user screen

fields.description:
*Regression*: Instance with JIRA and Confluence previously directed a user with Confluence-only permissions to wiki/dashboard.action

*Current behaviour*: User is defaulted to the JIRA dashboard and needs to navigate manually.

*Fix*: user should be defaulted to an application they actually have access to. 

Another possible fix suggested was to introduce the ability to set the starting application for each users.
fields.summary: Users are being defaulted to land in JIRA, regardless of whether they have access or not
When trying to change someone's password, I get an "authentication required" pop up

fields.description: When going to https://rokkmedia.atlassian.net/login? and clicking one the Unable to access your account? link and going to https://rokkmedia.atlassian.net/login/forgot you can get the password reset link email but when you click on the button it will redirect you to the reset password page but the authentication pop-up comes up. If you cancel / exit it will redirect you to https://rokkmedia.atlassian.net/login where you can't cahnge the password.
fields.summary: Password reset link requires  user login crowd REST end user authentication

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Start an instance with JIRA + Confluence.
# Add some users.
# Disable JIRA.

Check Crowd's database, and the {{active}} flag has been set to {{F}} and those users can no longer log in. [~rmassaioli] suspects the cause is the {{AddJ2C}} service that maintains user cross license changes that was added as part of the work to allow customers to add and remove JIRA from Confluence-only instances.

There's currently no way in the UI to re-active these users, so customers running into this have to raise a support request to have us do it.
fields.summary: Users added under JIRA + Confluence when JIRA is turned off have "active" flag set to false

fields.description:
When import users from *Bitbucket* or *Github* there are users without email accounts, these users will be imported into *User Management*.

However it'll return the following error message when trying to edit the email account of this user inside the User Management:
{code}
An unknown error has occurred.
{code}

Workaround:
Open a support ticket into support.atlassian.com asking to atlassian support set the user's email manually into the database.
fields.summary: Error happens when trying to import users from Github or Bitbucket account.

fields.description:
Users are asked to log in again when navigating to the Webdav, this includes when trying to download a Backup generated by the Backup manager.

This is very confusing if the instance is integrated with Google Apps, as the user will usually never use their Local Password.

*workaround for Google Users*
* Reset the OnDemand password, this will not affect the Google Apps account.
* Log in with the username, not the full email.
fields.summary: OnDemand requests Password for WebDav/Backup Download even though the Google Apps user is logged in

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 14 November 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how we can continue improving your experience with our products.

We understand that improved user management logs are a highly requested and useful feature for our customers. We plan to work on this feature in the near future, and will be tracking future updates to it here: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/ACCESS-577

Please refer to that ticket for information about this feature going forward.

Thanks,
Rak Garg
Product Manager, Atlassian
{panel}
 

Before the unified administration, the audit logs would show which user changed made the changes related to users:

!old_user_management.png!

After the unified administration, that's no longer shown, it shows "JIRA" as the author of the change:

!new_user_management.png!
fields.summary: Audit logs don't show author of user and group changes after introducing unified administration

fields.description:
Some customers cannot complete the last step of the Google Apps integration.
The common thing is that they can't complete the last step - they reach the last part where they get to MAC to complete the integration at which point they receive the message:
"Unfortunately we are unable to locate an eligible Atlassian OnDemand
instance associated with your Atlassian user account"
fields.summary: Users cannot complete sign up with Google Apps integration for OnDemand instances

fields.description:
According to the documentation (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Changing+your+Password), I should be able to hide change password link to users from their profile page. However, it still appears.
Is there any workaround to this issue ?
I'm also looking for a way to implement a password policy on an OnDemand instance.
Thanks !
fields.summary: Unable to deactivate change password link

fields.description:
Under the default group name setup it isn't possible to be just a JIRA Administrator without having access to Confluence

When you have more than one OnDemand product like JIRA and Confluence and there are admin users with the *application access* for both applications.

By Removing the *Confluence Application Access* the user will automatically removed from the *administrators* group.

Steps to reproduce it:
- Create the *atlassiantest* user with *JIRA* and *Confluence* applications access.
- Add *atlassiantest* user into the *administrators* group.
- Remove the *Confluence Application Access* for *atlassiantest* user

The you will see this user will be removed from the *administrators* group.

Its important because if this user is a JIRA admin, this user should not be removed from this group.

*Workaround*

# Create two groups - 'jira-administrators' and 'confluence-admins'
# Edit the [JIRA Global Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Managing+Global+Permissions] so that 'jira-administrators' is a JIRA Administrator
# Edit the [Confluence Global Permissions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Global+Permissions+Overview] so that 'confluence-admins' has 'Confluence Administrator' permission
# Add users to the jira-administrators group if you want them to have only JIRA admin access, and the confluence-admin group for Confluence
# Remove the 'administrators' group from JIRA and Confluence Global Permissions. It's a good idea to keep the administrators group around though, and keep users in it, as webdav access is reliant on that group (because of [AOD-6509|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-6509])
fields.summary: When remove Confluence application access it remove the administrators group

fields.description:
Everytime I click on the "Verify my email" link in the email, the page from atlassian will be loading indefinitely, eventually timing out. My email never actually gets verified. I can't do anything without verifing my email first, and verifying my email is broken!

brad.arsenault@onlineparty.ca
fields.summary: Verify my Email for Atlassian ID times out

fields.description: This is really an AGMP issue, but I'm filing it here because we track time in JST.
fields.summary: User import code contains javascript and css inside vm templates

fields.description:
According to the https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Editing+User+Details documentation, administrators should be able to edit a user's details to update their information in a Confluence-only Cloud instance, such as email address or company information, from the user details screen:

!user_profile.png!

*Problem*

At the moment, administrators can only edit *Name* and *Email Address* when following the steps outlined inside the https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Editing+User+Details documentation:

!edit_user_details.png!

It's not possible to edit any other information (e.g. company information, phone number, etc). 

This information can still be updated by the users themselves. However, as stated in the documentation, administrators should be able to edit the user's details.
fields.summary: Administrators are unable to edit user details

fields.description: When creating a new user account on the new User manager we cannot remove the Bitbucket access and Bitbucket admin access anymore.
fields.summary: Option to remove the new user account from Bitbucket administration group during the creation isn't available on the new User Management.

fields.description:
We noticed some instances where Spaces had Individual Permissions set with only 'Admin' permission ticked and users weren't able to access the admin section. On every case, adding the 'View' permission solved the problem.

We tested it and found that there is no possible way from the UI to grant only Admin permissions without the 'View' permission. Also, removing the 'View' permission will remove the user from the permissions configuration.

*Workaround:*
* Ask another admin of the Space to grant 'View' permissions or contact OnDemand Support to grant them for you.
fields.summary: Space Permission with Admin but no View denies access to space

fields.description:
We are trying out your new integration with Google (identity, apps, etc). Very few of our Atlassian usernames are the same as the first part of the email addresses, thus we end up duplicate accounts and no real way to merge them.

For example, we have followed your support notes for dealing with how to change an account name (allow closed workflow steps access to edit, reassign to the new account, change all of the reporters to the new account). 

That mostly works, but ... there are comments with the old account and I have yet to find the mojo to change all of the comments to the new account. Besides, this effort applied to each and every account will kill me. Since it doesn't even work, we've stopped for now.

You should change your algorithm for the new google account merge to match email addresses instead of trying to use the front half of a google mail account name with the Atlassian/Jira account name. In our case, this is almost always going to match (email addresses in Jira and email addresses in Google are always the same, but the characters before the @ - the google "account name" is seldom the same as our Jira account names (shame on us for not be prescient).

Until we get a fix for this, we consider the new Google feature not a feature, just a fantasy.
fields.summary: Fix the google integration to match email addresses instead of the account name.

fields.description: The logoff confirmation option currently doesn't work because of an infrastructure change.  This option should either be set as "Always" only or just remove the option entirely.
fields.summary: Disable Logout Confirmaton for OnDemand

fields.description:
'User login details' are not reported in any of the User Management pages. Users have logged in and are successfully using, but details reported as 'not recorded'.
Suspect that this is because they cannot and do not access JIRA, and what all these pages report is JIRA use only.
fields.summary: OnDemand user login details incorrectly reported

fields.description:
The default permissions group in confluence is unable to be changed or have use permissions unassigned. 

The confluence group manager 'lets' you remove access, but the config rest endpoint automatically re-includes it when looking at Jira user access. As such, a group is giving access that does not exist (or does not have permissions)
fields.summary: Unable to remove permissions from confluence default group

fields.description:
After letting the session timeout (when logged into an OnDemand instance) and going back to the system dashboard (attempting to login again), when clicking on the 'Log in' button (upper right), the log in page displays correctly - everything working as expected.

However, when you place the credentials and attempt to log in, the system redirects you directly to the system dashboard saying that you're not logged and if you attempt to click on the 'Log in' button again (upper right), the log in window doesn't popup anymore and you are redirected to the system dashboard - the page reloads. 

Restarting the browser seems to fix the problem temporarily until you timeout again.
fields.summary: After session timed out, the login button keeps redirecting to the dashboard page

fields.description:
Could be a nginx bug or misconfiguration.

Workaround is to clear cookies or use an alternative browser ( however even then this does not work for all cases )
fields.summary: Cannot log into OnDemand- Instance gives ngnix 502 error

fields.description:
Things like
{noformat}
Last Failed Login:	21/Aug/12 9:44 PM
Current Failed Login Count:	0
Total Failed Login Count:	3
{noformat}
display what lives in the JIRA cwd_user_attributes table.  However this data is stale and doesn't match reality.
fields.summary: cwd_user_attributes are not sync'd between horde and JIRA

fields.description:
When a new user is created, the email link sent to user via email is broken.  This has to do with creating new users on: https://staples.atlassian.net.

SEN-2238186
fields.summary: Hosted new user email link is broken

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a User with a + in their username or a Space. 'user name'
# Follow the 'set password' link in the email, the page gives a 'no valid token' error.

*workaround*
The Administrator of your instance must reset the password for you.
or
Replace the + in the username in the URL with a %20
eg {{https://example.atlassian.net/admin/users/resetpassword/32769/3c5afa49618b5c7f65924f849375e11190814726?username=User+Name}} -> {{https://example.atlassian.net/admin/users/resetpassword/32769/3c5afa49618b5c7f65924f849375e11190814726?username=User%20Name}}
fields.summary: "No valid reset token found for user" error if Username contains Spaces

fields.description:
Deleting customer users for the new Service Desk Billing model is not currently possible in JIRA + Confluence OnDemand instances. Whenever this is attempted in User Management, the following error occurs:
!cannot_delete_user_error.png!

It reads:
{panel}
Delete user
<User> cannot be deleted because of the following problems
Please resolve the following application references
Confluence
User does not have the required privileges
{panel}

This problem is not happening on JIRA-only instances.

*Steps to reproduce*
* Have a JIRA + Confluence OnDemand instance with the new Service Desk Billing model
* Create a customer via the Service Desk
* Try to remove it via User Management
* The error will occur

*Workarounds*
* No workaround available yet
fields.summary: Cannot delete customer users created in Service Desk, if Confluence OnDemand is enabled

fields.summary: Add User form validation causes 500 error

fields.description:
I've seen two different cases now where customers have raised their user count in MAC and it's propagated everywhere except Confluence itself. The {{studio.license}} file contains the correct details. Running {{aod_refresh_license}} returns an error (which I can't give the exact text of because it currently returns "Down for maintenance" :P).

The fix has been to hit Confluence's license reload REST endpoint ({{/rest/ondemand/license/1.0/license/load}}).
fields.summary: Confluence-only instances not picking up user count changes

fields.description:
In JIRA's predelete group validation, it checks if the group is associated with any comment or worklog (as part of the security level).

In the case that it is able to find such a comment or worklog, the error message provided is "You must specify a group to move comments/worklogs to.".

We need to either:
# include a link to the comments and worklogs in question in the message, or
# provide the ability to specify a fallback group, where any comments/worklogs as found above will be transferred to another group.
fields.summary: Groups that have comments/worklogs associated with them are not deletable

fields.description:
Changes to first and last names, usernames or emails of Google Apps users are not synchronized to an Ondemand instance connected to Google Apps for some users. Some new Google Apps users may be missing first and lastnames when they first login to an Ondemand instance. This affects only a small subset of Google Apps users.

The issue appears to be caused by invalid data returned by Google Directory APIs.  We are currently investigating the issue with Google support.
fields.summary: Changes to Google Apps users details are not updated in Ondemand

fields.description: Since the login screen change on the 10th of September 2012, intermittently after Google Apps is integrated with an instance crowd needs to be restarted in order to get the Google Apps option to appear on the login screen.
fields.summary: Crowd requires a restart after integrating with Google Apps

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# In Safari, create a user
# Click on _Create User_ button to submit the form

*Actual Results:*
- The form doesn't redirect to the next page (User Page). Administrator has to click once more. But when he does, it's stating that the user with that username has been created.

*Expected Results:*
- The form redirects to the next page confirming the user creation

*Other Info:*
- This also happens to the user deletion process.
- This doesn't happen in Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: When creating/deleting user, it doesn't redirect on the first click on the first submit in Safari

fields.description:
On the User Browser page ( /secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa ) in OnDemand, there is a column indicating the total login count for that user. In OnDemand (but not standalone JIRA), this number is twice the size it should be.

For example, if you create a new user and log in as that user once, it will show "2".
fields.summary: Login counts shown in User Browser are double the correct value
Jira On Demand administrator gets "it looks like you're trying to log in with an email address" message

fields.description:
Customer is receiving weird values for application access. It seems that this is seemingly caused by  "jira.numHostedUsers": "2000" found at the instance license key. 

h3.Expected Results:
The application access should show 6 remaining access (25-19=6)

h3.Actual Results:
The application access should showing 1981 (2000-19=1981)

h3.Workaround:
None at the moment.
fields.summary: Email Account Creation Notification Showing Wrong Application Access Value

fields.description:
I'm on Atlassian cloud. I've had the public sign up on for eons but the "filter by domain" flag had been enabled but there were no domains listed. So nobody was able to sign up.

If the domains are empty - the behavior really should be that either public sign up is disabled or there is no filtering...
fields.summary: Public sign up was enabled but no domains specified

fields.description:
The previous user management system would inform the administrator that they were about to invite a user to join Bitbucket in the following groups:

!Bitbucket_invites.png!

The new user management system doesn't mention anything about user invitations, but it does still send them as per the DVCS connector automatic access (as per [this guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/Configure+Automatic+Team+Invites]).
fields.summary: New user management system doesn't mention that Bitbucket invites are going to be sent

fields.description:
Some customers have reported being unable to log in via Google Apps to their instances. When logging in, they would receive the message:
"The OpenID response was invalid or malformed".

h3. Status
* We had reproduced the issue on our own testing instances. The problem seems to be inconsistent: repeatedly attempting to log in will eventually succeed.
* The apparent cause was inconsistent responses from Google.
* As of about 9am GMT+10 (2014-09-26), we've been unable to reproduce the issue. Analysis of log data shows that error rates have dropped back to normal levels.

h3. Temporary Workarounds:
* Repeatedly attempt to log in.
* Use the OnDemand login without Google Apps that works as expected. If users don't have a password yet, they can set a new password by clicking _"Unable to access your account?"_

h3. Further info
In one case this problem only happened when the user had 2-steps verification on, while not in others. -In some cases, the problem solved itself, while in others restarting the instance was necessary.- Update: from what we know right now, it's likely that restarting the instance has no effect; it's likely that "it's fixed now after restarting the instance" came more from trying to log in again than from the restart.
fields.summary: Users unable to log in to JIRA via Google Apps

fields.description:
By default, JIRA OnDemand session for a user should be timed out in 30 minutes. However, the user is not logged out even after an hour from JIRA, knowing that the following:
* The user is not active during that time on that web-browser or any other machine
* The option *Keep me logged in* was un-checked

Attached screen-shot for the behavior, along with the timing.

*Steps to produce*:
# Login with a user into your OnDemand instance
# Keep the web-browser window inactive for more than 30 minutes.

*Expected Behavior*:
The user is logged out and he needs to login again in order to perform any operations within JIRA

*Actual Behavior*:
The user is still logged in and he can still perform operations without the need to login again.
fields.summary: Session is not timeedout after thirty minutes

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 14 January 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}Hi everyone, If the site can be browsed normally from a different network, it means that the local network configuration is blocking Amazon CDN servers. Please ensure that you have white listed the CDN IPs to allow browsing Amazon CDNs. The list can be found at [IP address range used by OnDemand|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/IP+address+range+used+by+OnDemand].
Cheers, Atlassian OnDemand
{panel}

Some customers have had a problem where they would get a broken UI when accessing UM. The pages would show like the print screen below:
!admin-site-broken.jpg|thumbnail!

The issues were not reproducible and they seem to depend on some configuration the users had in their machines or network. Accessing UM with their own accounts did not reproduce the problem.
fields.summary: Broken User Management due to CDN Access

fields.description:
After a new Google user is created via background sync, but before the new user logs in for the first time, if the admin views the user, there is a warning about no group membership:
The user John Doe does not belong to any groups. This means the user will not be able to log on until they are added to a group.

However, if the admin follows the advice and add the new user to the 'users' group, when the new user tries to log in for the first time, the new user won't be granted default application access as the Google Integration code assumes that whether to grant or decline application access to the user has already been decided before.
fields.summary: "No group membership" warning on new Google user is misleading

fields.description:
Customers have reported that when creating a new email within the OnDemand User Management page with the *Email a link to the user to set their password* option checked the email is not being sent. 

After investigating at least one customer pointed out that the browser extension *Lastpass* was causing issues with the javascript on the page and that was resulting on on the email not being sent. We have customers who reported that the *Ad Block Edge* and the *1password* extensions cause the same issue.

Atlassian support is currently investigating if any other extensions could be causing this as well. Both Chrome and Internet Explorer 11 seem to be affected, it’s yet to be confirmed if other browsers are being affected as well.

*Steps to reproduce*
# Have an OnDemand instance
# Have either Chrome or Internet Explorer 11 with [Lastpass|https://lastpass.com]
# Create user in User Management
#* Make sure 'Email a link to the user to set their password' is selected
# Invitation email is not sent

*Workaround*
Either disable those extensions before creating new users or perform this operation using Inconito/Private browsing mode so any extensions that could be causing this are disabled.
fields.summary: New User Email Not Being Sent When Creating New Users on A Browser With The Lastpass or the  Ad Block Edge Extension Installed

fields.description:
With the new UM update, if a user was explicitly given 'can use' permission to confluence, you're unable to remove their app access even if they have been removed from all groups and end user gets an unknown error.

WORKAROUND - go to global permissions and remove 'can use' access from user
fields.summary: If individual users are given can use access to Confluence, you cannot revoke app access

fields.description:
Don't know if this was introduced with RotP or is the same as in previous versions.

Just wanted to create a test user and forgot to enter the confirm password. The dialog showed the error, but dropped my selection for the check boxes to create users on Conf, FECru and Bamboo.
fields.summary: Create user screen looses some of the values when the passwords don't match

fields.description:
When I share a link to a resource on our on-demand JIRA with my colleague, the first time he opens the link it opens his dashboard page instead.  If he then opens the link a second time, it opens the correct page.  The same happens with bookmarks sometimes.

An example would be a link to a report: https://gulfstream.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=1&view=reporting&chart=versionReport&version=10100

Feels like the first request stores a cookie that makes the second request work.
fields.summary: Shared links (sometimes) only open the second time

fields.description: Currently, Google Apps users are not showing up as Google Users but as Crowd Users
fields.summary: Google Apps users are showing up as Crowd Users

fields.description: If you create an OnDemand instance with Google Apps integration and the administrator has not finished the UserImport.jspa step then a regular user will get a permissions error even though they correctly authenticated with JIRA. The permissions exception screen in JIRA should show some better information for GApps instances that are still in this state.
fields.summary: Permission error with no good messaging for GApps non admin users.

fields.description:
If a product doesn't have any more available licenses, you cannot add users to administrative groups. The following message is displayed:

!message.png!
fields.summary: Cannot add users to administrative groups if one product reached max licenses

fields.description:
When trying to log in as a user *without* groups and *with* applications access in one or more applications, the user is redirected to the system dashboard URL with a message that he/she is not logged in and when clicking on the 'Log In' link in the top right of the screen - it keeps redirecting to the same page (dashboard). 

This issue is a failure of handling no-group user accounts to prevent extreme confusion.

Please, see steps to reproduce below:

*1*. Create user and take him off of all groups
!user_management.png!

*2*. Grant him application access in one or more applications
!app_access.png!

*3*. Now, try to log in with this user
!login.png!

*4*. Get redirected to the dashboard page, with a message that you are not logged in and when clicking on the 'Log In' link in the top right of the screen - it just refreshes the page.
!dashboard.png!
fields.summary: Trying to log in as a user without groups gives no warning or error

fields.description:
In instances running only Confluence or Confluence+JIRA+Bamboo, duplicate links to user management features are displayed:
- in the cog icon menu in the top navigation bar;
- in the Confluence Admin screen.

Links point to different URLs: https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/users/browseusers.action and http://example.atlassian.net/admin.
All is displayed fine in instances running JIRA.
fields.summary: Duplicate User Managment menu entries in Confluence-only instances

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Set up a JIRA Server with several users.
# Export the JIRA Server data and import it to Cloud.
# Add users in the Cloud instance.
# Export the Cloud data and import them in any other instance.

*Result:* All users originating from the local instance (step 1) will lose their passwords. See database details below.
fields.summary: Users imported to Cloud from Server lose their passwords whenever the Cloud instance gets exported

fields.description: The fields are read-only within Confluence's UI due to the way Confluence is configured (External User management enabled).  Currently, if a change is required for a Confluence only OnDemand instance, Atlassian Support will need to make the changes.
fields.summary: Administrators are not able to update user details (email,firstname,lastname) in Confluence OnDemand

fields.description:
Steps to produce:
# Add Google user (grant the application access but don't associate the user with any groups)
# Try to login with this user.

Results:
# The user still login with no warning or error messages which is not expected for normal External User (see [AOD-6127|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/AOD-6127])
# If the users tries to access instance's functions such as (Issue Navigator, create dashboard ..etc), it will redirect them to the login page again.
fields.summary: Google Users with no groups membership and with application access granted are still able to login

fields.description:
Steps to replicate:

# Attempt to log in as a user but add a space at the end, e.g. 'jsmith '

Result:

Login fails

Desired Result:

Login succeeds as the white space will be trimmed
fields.summary: OnDemand sign in doesn't trim white space at the end of a username

fields.description: The user's failed login count is not getting updated upon failing to login on the OnDemand environment. Crowd seems to be getting the "invalidPasswordAttempts" without any problems, however inside the instance, in the 'Users' page (_instance-name_.atlassian.net/secure/admin/user/UserBrowser.jspa) the system displays nothing about failed login counts and if you click on the user's name and go to its account information, the "Current Failed Login Count" is always set to 0.
fields.summary: Failed Login Count not working

fields.description: When syncing a Google Apps domain to an OnDemand instance, if no Application Access is specified on the Google Management admin page, the synced users will not be added to the mandatory group specified on that same screen. As a consequence of that, if one of these users is later granted access to JIRA, he *still won't be* a member of the "mandatory" group and will not be able to login. Very confusing & painful for customers.
fields.summary: Google Apps users are not added to the mandatory group if no application access is specified

fields.description:
h2. Steps to (sometimes) reproduce:
- log into Cloud with your default browser,
- click a link to an OnDemand instance (e.g. from a JIRA notification email) from a third-party application (e.g. email client),
- the link will open in the browser that already has a current session in that Cloud instance, yet will prompt you to login.

h2. The third-party applications that have been involved in reported cases include:
- MS Outlook
- MS OneNote
- MS Word

h2. Workaround
With the [registry change|http://support.microsoft.com/kb/218153] in place, no requests emanate from the office apps: they are handed over to IE immediately. This should prevent the redirection to the login page, and could therefore be a suitable workaround for customers suffering from this problem. 

The [registry change|http://support.microsoft.com/kb/218153] consists of setting or creating a *{{DWORD}}* key *{{ForceShellExecute}}* with value *{{1}}* under *{{HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Office\9.0\Common\Internet}}*.
fields.summary: Clicking a link to Cloud from an MS Office application with a browser already logged in results in login prompt

fields.description:
If an instance has no available license spots for <Application>, and the customer attempts to add <username> to a group that would result in <username> being granted <Application> access, they can click on the button to add the user / group however nothing happens as a result, and no message is displayed on the screen. 

From the Javascript console, you'll see that the POST function that is failing. The response message says "<Application> - you have reached the license limit for this application. You only have 0 seat(s) left, but require 1 seat(s) to add these user(s): <username>."]}".

Error message in the console is:

{noformat}
POST https://instance.atlassian.net/admin/rest/um/1/user/group/direct?username=user 400 (Bad Request) jquery.min.js:2
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'errorBody' of undefined
{noformat}
fields.summary: Cannot add users to group(s) if the Confluence license spots don't match - needs UX improvement

fields.description:
Currently it is not possible to change the email address of an Atlassian ID as mentioned in the [FAQ|https://id.atlassian.com/about/faq#cat3q7]. 

Please allow me to change my email address in my [Atlassian ID Profile|https://id.atlassian.com/profile/] and reflect the change to all my connected services.
fields.summary: Change Atlassian ID email address

fields.description:
First of all, sorry if it's reported into a wrong project, this is dedicated to the atlassian user profile website (id.atlassian.com)

I got an e-mail activation mail after clicking on something on Bitbucket. I decided to claim my account on Atlassian by activating my account here.

Then, after I clicked on the activation link, I was prompted to edit and save my name (here: https://id.atlassian.com/profile/profile.action), what I did. I had JavaScript disabled (NoScript). I've clicked on the "Save changes button" and got the HTTP 403 error: HTTP Status 403 - Invalid CSRF Token 'null' was found on the request parameter '_csrf' or header 'X-CSRF-TOKEN'.
Then I enabled JavaScript for Atlassian.com and tried again. This time everything worked fine.
fields.summary: HTTP 403 for new user with disabled JS

fields.description:
The message *{{admin.workflow.validator.regexpfield.infobox.text}}* has an invalid placeholder that causes an exception when trying to add a Regular Expression Validation to a Workflow transition. The problem is *{color:#de350b}{\\{target}}{color}* {color:#de350b}and the missing{color} *<* {panel:title=admin.workflow.validator.regexpfield.infobox.text} Puedes marcar campos que contengan texto, n\u00fameros, direcciones URL o tipos de selecci\u00f3n para hacerlos coincidir con una expresi\u00f3n regular determinada. Por ejemplo\:
  • [0-9]\{4}-[0-9]\{4} permitir\u00eda n\u00fameros como los siguientes\: 1245-7783
  • [0-9]+ EUR{*}{color:#de350b}{\{target}}lt;/strong>{color}{*} permitir\u00eda etiquetas de precio como\: 34 EUR
  • [a-z]* permitir\u00eda una cadena vac\u00eda o cualquier palabra en min\u00fasculas, como\: amarillo
  • Opci\u00f3n [A,B] permitir\u00eda una selecci\u00f3n de opciones, como\: Opci\u00f3n A, Opci\u00f3n B o ambas.
{panel}     Affected files:  # jira_cloud_i18n_es_ES.properties # cmdb-module-i18n_es_ES.properties More details: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-72978
fields.summary: Invalid placeholder causes an exception in spanish

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in the customer view, the *Notification on* is displayed as "Benachrichtigungen ein" which translates to "Notifications" and *Notification off* is displayed as "Benachrichtigungen aus" which translates to "Notifications off".

The problem is that the wording is ambiguous in German, it is not clear whether the link must be clicked in order to receive notifications or whether the current state already implies that notifications are received right now (the default).
h3. Suggested Solution

Improve the translation of "{*}Notification on{*}" from "Benachrichtigungen ein" to "keine Benachrichtigungen erhalten"(Receive no notification) or "Benachrichtigungen sind an"(Notifications are on) and "{*}Notification Off{*}" from Benachrichtigungen aus" to "Benachrichtigungen erhalten"(Receive notifications) or "Benachrichtigungen sind aus"(Notifications are off)
fields.summary: Improve German translation of "Notification on" and "Notification off" in customer view
Wrong translation for "Allow others to select objects from this schema"

fields.description:
Affected page:
* Business project > Summary (Right side of the screen)
fields.summary: Incorrect translataion - "Last week most active"

fields.description: See screenshot attached: on the customer portal, three lines above the marked word 'Visualization', there is an untranslated line 'Forms' which should probably read 'Formulaires'
fields.summary: Untranslated word 'Forms' on customer portal

fields.description:
Target page:
* https://admin.atlassian.com/o/<org id>/members/<account id>

 !AtlassianSupport 2021-12-20 at 10.26.57.png|thumbnail! 

This warning is only displayed on the page of users whose accounts are planned to be deleted by the organization admin.
fields.summary: Incorrect translation - "It was scheduled for deletion by <user name>"

fields.description:
Dear Support,

 

we are configuring Jira Service Management in Clouf for our client, who will be using the system in Czech language. And the client noticed that field "Request type" is not translated to Czech language and remains in English.

It should be translated as "Typ požadavku".

 

thank you

Jitka Horníková
fields.summary: Translation of "Request type" missing in Czech language on JSM Cloud

fields.description: Customer uses forms in their tickets (screenshot shows ticket IT-341), and are seeing a line 'En mode visualization' which should actually read 'En mode visualisation' instead
fields.summary: Line 'En mode virtualization' should read 'En mode virtualisation' instead

fields.description:
Hello

For example: field "Created" - in Russian "Создано", but actually we have "Cоздано" - a combination of Latin C letter and the rest of letters in Cyrillic.

This error is widely spread in another systems, so you are not alone ;)

Here is a screenshot:

!image-2021-12-14-15-00-41-705.png!

We have this problem on Jira 8.13.1 & 8.20.1 (both are LTS)

p.s. it's better to look through all your eng->rus translation files to find all possible occurrences of this.
fields.summary: Some field names may have combination of cyryllic and latin symbols in it

fields.description:
As a Brazilian-Portuguese Jira user, I would like to report 2 translation errors on the comment screen when included in a transition screen:

"Your comment will be visible to customers. Embed attachments to make them visible to customers."

Translated to:

"Seu comentário será visível para clientes. Encorpore anexos para torná-los visível para clientes."

"Encorpore" is incorrect, "Incorpore" is correct.

In the case of "torná-los visível", the problem is one of verbal agreement, if it is "torná-los" in the plural, then it should be "torná-los visíveis" and not "visível".
fields.summary: Translation error on Issue comment section

fields.description:
Hello,

 

When I set the Jira default language as Turkish, I cannot see any change from the menu names or other texts supposed to be translated in Turkish.
fields.summary: Turkish translation is not working

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users cannot select an issue type and another with the localized name when they use the basic search in a non-English language.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a CMP having an issue type named "Bug"
 # Create a TMP having an issue type named "バグ"
 # Select "basic" search mode
 # Ensure your language is set to "English" at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 # Confirm you can select both "Bug" and "バグ" for issue types
 ** !jin-en.png|thumbnail!
 # Change your language to "Japanese (日本語)" at [https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences]
 # Confirm you only can select "バグ" but not "Bug"
 ** !jin-ja.png|thumbnail!
 # Confirm you cannot search "Bug"
 ** !jin-ja-search.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to select both "Bug" and "バグ" because they have different IDs.
h3. Actual Results

Only the localized issue type can be selected.
h3. Workaround

Try the advanced search with the following JQL:
{code:none}
issuetype in (Bug, バグ) order by created DESC
{code}
fields.summary: Only the localized issue type can be selected for the basic search

fields.description:
This string is shown when trying to cancel the subscription. The current translation "財政的な困難" is using the terms that are used only for governments.

For the two reasons above, we recommend updating the translation to "何かお困りですか?" which means "Are you having any difficulties?/Need help?"
- The same string is shown when the plan is Free (which means there should be no _financial_ difficulties)
- The original string gives an impression like we are offering discount upon request

If the recommendation above is not appropriate from a l10n perspective, please update it to "経済的にお困りですか?" which is the literal translation.
fields.summary: Update translation for "Are you facing financial difficulties?"

fields.description:

fields.description:
In the issue navigator, the German translation of "bulk change" is "Mehrfachänderung". 
This translates to multi-edit and sounds like editing mutiple fields on one issue, thus, the normal behaviour of the edit screen. The appropriate translation for bulk change in German is Stapelverarbeitung"
fields.summary: Correct German translation of bulk change

fields.description:
Dear Atlassian internationalization team,

Četrta pot d.o.o. requires Jira and Confluence in Slovenian language, but we have found that the Slovenian language is not on your list of provided language packs.

Please provide us with information regarding the options of getting our language supported.

We can cooperate with our own team of professional translators. Please inform us how many words there are in a language pack so that we can have a clearer picture of what such translation entails.

Kindest regards,

Irma Sutlič
fields.summary: Language for Slovenian language (Slovenia) for Cloud

fields.description: "Insight" in JSW is not a unique name so it should be localized.

fields.description: !Screen Shot 2021-11-09 at 17.30.30.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Translation error in the Update URL - Atlassian Access

fields.description:
In the translation file I saw:

```
"Be the first to add a reaction" = "Sii il primo ad aggiungere una reazione";
```

In English "first" has no gender, but "il primo" in Italian is masculine and thus incorrect for many of our users.

For a more inclusive message I propose something along the lines of "Sii la prima persona ad aggiungere una reazione" (be the first person to add a reaction)
fields.summary: iOS "Be the first to add a reaction" Italian translation

The Plan doesn't localize the dates as the basic Jira roadmaps:

fields.summary: Dates are not localized in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
The translation key is `sd.agent.queue.incidents.filter.display.label.unlinked`.

It should be translated as '未关联事务'.

Because `取消关联的事务` implies the issues had previously been linked now are 'unlinked'; '未关联事务', on the other hand, means 'issues not yet linked', which reflects actual behavior of the system when this option is selected.
fields.summary: Incorrect 'Unlinked issues' Chinese translation

fields.description:
When creating a documentation space, a how-to template page is automatically created with the title "How-To Article." The Russian translation of this title includes quotes Статья "Вопросы и Ответы" which seem unnecessary. Google Translate also translates this as {{Article "Questions and Answers"}}
 
These quotes are in the i18n strings `com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-knowledge-base.how-to-blueprint.index.page.title` and `com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-knowledge-base.how-to-blueprint.display.name`.
fields.summary: Remove quotes from Russian translation of "How-To Article"

fields.description:
||Source||Current target||Suggested target||
|Canceled|キャンセルされました|キャンセル済み or キャンセル|
|Escalated|エスカレートされた|エスカレート済み or エスカレーション (I don't think the Japanese word エスカレート is too common)|
|Reopened|再オープンされました|再オープン|
|work in progress|進行中の作業|作業の進行中|
|pending|ペンディング|保留|
|waiting for approval|承認を待っています|承認待ち|
|declined|却下されたプル リクエスト|却下|
|implementing|導入中|実装中|
